channel.title: Continue Tweaking the Scorned
channel.description:
The new Scorned was just announced, but I think it'll need a few slight tweaks to prevent it from losing its old identity.
In short, the new Scorned now needs to survive long enough to see four public executions. It also has a new night ability alongside Frame called "Stalk", which allows it to investigate players to determine their alignment up to three times.
The problem? This kit and wincon are not incompatible with the Blue Dragon. In fact, the ability to investigate may be directly helpful to them! This can be a problem, as it is now not only possible but in fact desiriable for the Scorned to out themselves, promise not to frame people, and act as the Blue Dragon's new investigator.
What really makes this problematic is the fact that Scorned is immediately provable and essentially unkillable at night. Having Trollbox allows the Scorned to prove that it isn't the NK, Unseen, or Cult, and having full-time night immunity means thaf a rogue Scorned is much harder for the other evils to stop than it should be. Sure, you can use night-immunity-piercing methods to kill it, but those are usually slow and/or limited for the scum, requiring either the Neutral Killer or the main faction to put a heavy investment into killing somebody that could, and in fact *should*, be their ally (something they should both usually avoid, especially the NK).
So, how do we fix this? I don't honestly think it would be that hard. Simply change Scorned's wincon from needing to live to see four executions to needing to see three Blue Dragon executed *or* to see the Blue Dragon lose. This essentially prevents the new Scorned from becoming an ally to the BD.
Additionally, I think Stalk is better off being replaced with Bait and Switch, a move that works just like the Court Wizard's tornado. The ability to swap around players can help you protect scummy players, frame good ones, and generally confuse the Blue Dragon to help you achieve your goal.
So, where does that leave us?
> <big>**[color=darkred]The Scorned[/color]</big>** >**[color=grey]Neutral Social[/color]** > >**Resolve (Passive) -** Immune to most occupation and redirection abilities. Immune to death at night. This is lost when you achieve your objective. > >**Troll Box (Day) -** Choose a target player and whisper a short phrase into the troll box. It will appear as if that player said it. *(Infinite uses)* > >**Frame (Night) -** Make your target appear suspicious to investigative classes. *(Infinite uses)* >**Bait and Switch (Night) -** Cause all players targeting one of your targets to target the other. Bypasses redirection immunity. *(3 uses)* > >*Your objective is to live to see 3 members of the Blue Dragon publicly executed, or to live to see the Blue Dragon defeated.*
I think this Scorned works much better at blending its old nature with a new, more general wincon, and would love to see it implemented soon.
Oh, and if you still want Stalk, if this Scorned needs a buff it could always come back as a day ability. Three uses seems like a bit much, as day investigations can be really powerful, but on this version of the Scorned it should be okay. After all, it's certainly not using day investigations to find the scum anymore!
>**Stalk (Day) -** Discover a player's faction. *(2 uses)*

item.title: Continue Tweaking the Scorned
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
RHCube:

I didn’t mean that there were too many anti-X neutrals, just that true neutrals are better

That depends on the purpose of that spacific class.

For classes like Alch and Merc that is absolutely true.

For classes like Scorned and Sellsword going against BD is required for them to achieve their purpose (note: purpose != Wincon)

Classes like Fool, Pretender and Inquisitor are weird and can really go either way. The reason to make Fool anti-BD is to make the class harder and vice versa for making him pro-BD. Same thing for Inquisitor and Pretender

TLDR: Scorned ought be Anti-BD so that a win for scorned requires scorned to deceve others and so that an accuser is likely to be scorned making that an actual defence in a counterclaim.

The reason scorned worked was because she wins after the flip and thus don’t need to care about the retribution for the play. Alternatively giving scorned a day defile (a defile that resolves during the day. Does not have to be a day ability) would accomplish the same effect

Since current Scorned can’t do that she is disincentivised to accuse BD. Since she has stalk and doesn’t care which faction is lynched she is incentivised to accuse real scum further defeating the point
